content.description: To the right (north) of Paying For Beta and the dihedral climb The Notch, Ticket To Easy Street starts on some good jugs and goes straight up on a ladder of holds.Good climb to warmup on and downclimb instead of taking the longer walkoff.
content.location: 34.71540925646328, -98.67318457136568From Dark Star head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.From Stack Boulder, head north 200 yds and pass Dark Star by 30 yds.  Head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.

content.description: On the face to the right (west) of The Wall's Dihedral climb "The Notch", sits a challenging face climb called Paying For Beta.Stand Start on a LH Gaston and a RH Sidepull. Find the crimps and rails - the Dihedral is off of course.
content.location: 34.71540925646328, -98.67318457136568From Dark Star head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.From Stack Boulder, head north 200 yds and pass Dark Star by 30 yds.  Head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.

content.description: Deep V-Shaped notch.Can be climbed like a chimney, stemming your way up to the top. Crux is the first couple of moves as the lower section of the rock is pretty featureless. Not an easy place to get a bouldering pad
content.location: Toward the left side of the wall, look for a deep V-shaped chimney in the rock.

content.description: Where The Wall starts to round off as it heads north and turn west on an arete, Junk Bonds starts in the noticeable horizontal incut rail.Refuge Bouldering recommends to Stand Start on the shelf at waist height and go straight up.In a large group of climbers, a sit start or hanging heel hook start was a popular method although it may up the difficulty a little.
content.location: 34.71540925646328, -98.67318457136568From Dark Star head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.From Stack Boulder, head north 200 yds and pass Dark Star by 30 yds.  Head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.

content.description: On The Wall's most northeast arete start on a vertical seam and use the shelf to go straight up. Suss out the better holds and mantle the lip for a great V1.
content.location: 34.71540925646328, -98.67318457136568From Dark Star head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.From Stack Boulder, head north 200 yds and pass Dark Star by 30 yds.  Head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.

content.description: Double Mantle Deluxe is a stand start problem that goes up the southern wall of The Wall area just left or east of The Notch dihedral.Mantle up onto the first shelf and figure out your second mantle. Pretty fun!
content.protection: 1 Pad should be sufficient since fall line is consistent. 2 if you need it.
content.location: 34.71540925646328, -98.67318457136568From Dark Star head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.From Stack Boulder, head north 200 yds and pass Dark Star by 30 yds.  Head north 30 yds and east downhill. Follow the features to your right and you should arrive at Huggy Bear and Gummy Bear in the Bear's Den.

content.description: Seated start with feet in an undercut at the base. Decent hand holds make for pretty smooth climbing. Crux is popping of from the seat, as the rest is straight forward.
content.location: Furthest right route on the wall. The start is to the left of a small oak tree. Look for the spot where the rock cuts inward at the base. That's the start.

content.description: The crux is hold selection, as a couple of holds feel less-than-bomber. Makes for a decent warm-up, but isn't worth going out of your way for.
content.location: Climb the corner on the right side of the wall.

content.description: This 60+ ft long wall runs 9-12 feet high, and has tons of possible lines on it. Shade can be found here along this short wall most of the day in one place or another, especially in The Notch, a tight v-shaped chimney that is shaded all day. The majority of the problems are vertical and crimpy, though a few overhanging routes exist. The granite is coarse and provides great grip.
